title:
Symmetry of the dissipation of surface acoustic waves by ferromagnetic
  resonance
authors:
Florian Millo, Rafael Lopes Seeger, Claude Chappert, Aur\'elie
  Solignac, Thibaut Devolder
abstract:
We study the symmetry of the coupling between surface acoustic waves and
ferromagnetic resonance in a thin magnetic film of CoFeB deposited on top of a
piezoelectric Z-cut LiNbO3 substrate. We vary the orientation of the applied
magnetic field with respect to the wavevector of the surface acoustic wave.
Experiments indicate an unexpected 2-fold symmetry of the absorption of the SAW
energy by the magnetic film. We discuss whether this symmetry can arise from
the magnetoelastic torque of the longitudinal strain and the magnetic
susceptibility of ferromagnetic resonance. We find that one origin of the
2-fold symmetry can be the weak in-plane uniaxial anisotropy present within the
magnetic film. This phenomena adds to the previously identified other source of
2-fold symmetry but shall persist for ultrathin films when the dipolar
interactions cease to contribute to the anisotropy of the slope of the spin
wave dispersion relation.
